sen.j: 覚快法親王（かくかいほっしんのう、長承3年（1134年） － 養和元年11月16日 (旧暦)（1181年12月23日））は、平安時代後期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Kakukai Hosshinno (1134 - December 23, 1181) was a Buddhist monk of Tendai Sect in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 13歳の時比叡山に上り、行玄大僧正に師事して出家、顕教・密教を兼学した。
sen.e: He entered Hieizan (Mt. Hiei) when he was 13 years old, and became a monk and studied Exoteric Buddhism as well as Esoteric Buddhism under Gyogen Daisojo (the highest title of Buddhist monk).

sen.j: 1150年（久安6年）に権律師となり、翌1151年（久安7年）行玄から伝法灌頂をうけ、法印に任じられた。
sen.e: He was conferred the title of Gon-Risshi (a title of Buddhist monk) in 1150 and in the following year, 1151, he received denpo-kanjo (the consecration for the transmission of the Dharma) from Gyogen and was conferred a rank of Hoin (the highest court rank given to a Buddhist monk).

sen.j: 1160年（永暦元年）宮中において日蝕の祈祷を行い効験があったという。
sen.e: In 1160, he conducted prayer at the Imperial Palace on the occasion of solar eclipse and it has been passed down that his prayer was efficacious.

sen.j: 1170年（嘉応2年）無品親王となり、1177年（治承元年）延暦寺座主明雲が流罪となった跡を受けて座主に就任、法性寺座主も兼任した。
sen.e: He became Muhon-Shinno (Imperial Prince without court rank) in 1170 and was inaugurated in 1177 as the chief priest of Enryaku-ji Temple after Myoun, his predecessor, was banished while concurrently serving as the chief priest of Hosho-ji Temple.

sen.e: He resigned from his posts in 1180 due to illness and entered into a secluded life at Shoren-in Temple.
